title: Quantity - much, many, any - 3
instructions: Complete the sentences with B1manyB2, B1muchB2 or B1anyB2.

sentence: This box is empty. There aren't
remarks: Corr: any. As the box is empty, we need to express that there are no pens in it at all. So only 'any' is correct.

sentence: food left at home, but it'll be enough. I'm doing a slimming diet.
remarks: Corr: much. The word 'food' is countable, so 'many' is not okay, and there is some, so we can exclude 'any', too.

sentence: chocolate left in the box, so I gave it to my son.
remarks: Corr: much. The word 'chocolate' is uncountable, so 'many' is not okay here, and there was some chocolate, so we cannot use 'any' either.

sentence: goals, so we lost the match 3-0.
remarks: Corr: any. As we scored no goals at all, only 'any' is correct.

sentence: good songs on this album, just the first two numbers.
remarks: Corr: many. The word 'song' is countable, so 'much' is not correct here, and there are two good songs, so we cannot use 'any', either.

sentence: salt in the soup, just a little.
remarks: Corr: much. The word 'salt' is uncountable, so 'many' is not correct, and we put in some, so 'any' is not correct either.

sentence: money, yet he didn't give me
remarks: Corr: much. The word 'money' is countable, so 'many' is not okay, and I did ask for some, so 'any' isn't correct either.
Corr: any. Peter gave me no money at all, so only 'any' is correct.

sentence: furniture in my cell, just a bed and a stool.
remarks: Corr: much. The word 'furniture' is uncountable, so we can exclude 'many', and there is some furniture, so we can exclude 'any', too.
Corr: many. The word 'task' is countable so we can exclude 'much' and as the boss did give us some tasks, we can exclude 'any', too.

sentence: times to use the recycle bin, but he doesn't care
remarks: Corr: many. The word 'time' is countable here, meaning the number of occasions, so 'much' is not okay, and we can exclude 'any', too as the sentence is not negative.
Corr: much. It's not about a countable noun, so 'many' and 'any' are not correct.
